alert.note: Alert for Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 11:14AM EDT until September 29 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Jersey, including the following counties, in central New Jersey...Monmouth. In southern New Jersey...Ocean. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1111 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain across portions of the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin where the heaviest rain has occurred. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. More rain is expected as we head into the afternoon. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Barnegat, Beachwood, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Seaside Heights, Lakehurst, Mantoloking, Holiday City South, and Holiday City-Berkeley. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 23. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 66 and 95. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
